body_html: Hi @jcjohnson . Thanks for the benchmark! I am currently working on a Random Number Generator refactor of PyTorch (#13070) and am replacing curandStateMtgp32 usages (which is currently used by multinomial on the CUDA side) with Philox RNG engine. While I am not sure how the new Philox engine would perform on the torch.multinomial, I would be happy to run your benchmarks after my PR is done and hopefully be able to give some perf on that kernel!
body_text: Hi @jcjohnson . Thanks for the benchmark! I am currently working on a Random Number Generator refactor of PyTorch (#13070) and am replacing curandStateMtgp32 usages (which is currently used by multinomial on the CUDA side) with Philox RNG engine. While I am not sure how the new Philox engine would perform on the torch.multinomial, I would be happy to run your benchmarks after my PR is done and hopefully be able to give some perf on that kernel!
body: Hi @jcjohnson . Thanks for the benchmark! I am currently working on a Random Number Generator refactor of PyTorch (https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/13070) and am replacing `curandStateMtgp32` usages (which is currently used by multinomial on the CUDA side) with Philox RNG engine. While I am not sure how the new Philox engine would perform on the `torch.multinomial`, I would be happy to run your benchmarks after my PR is done and hopefully be able to give some perf on that kernel!
